qas.question: How did British rule effect Indian cotton processing?
During what centuries did British rule effect Indian cotton production?
What British business's policies damaged the Indian cotton industry?
What cotton products did British law mandate that India was allowed to sell?
If instead of producing fabrics, where was India forced to purchase cotton products?
How did East India rule effect Indian cotton processing?
During what centuries did East India rule effect Indian cotton production?
What British business's policies damaged the British cotton industry?
What cotton products did Indian law mandate that India was allowed to sell?
Where was the British East India Company forced to purchase cotton products?

context: India's cotton-processing sector gradually <a0_0><b5_0>declined<b5_0/><a0_0/> during British expansion in India and the establishment of colonial rule during the <a1_0><b6_0>late 18th and early 19th<b6_0/><a1_0/> centuries. This was largely due to aggressive colonialist mercantile policies of the <a2_0><b7_0>British East India Company<b7_0/><a2_0/>, which made cotton processing and manufacturing workshops in India uncompetitive. Indian markets were increasingly forced to supply only <a3_0><b8_0>raw cotton<b8_0/><a3_0/> and, by British-imposed law, to purchase manufactured textiles from <a4_0><b9_0>Britain<b9_0/><a4_0/>.[citation needed]
